section.name: User Guide
section.span: How to work as a user of Hippo CMS.
section.p: Hippo CMS allows to define which role(s) a user may perform. In day to day usage, authors write and add content, and editors decide about publishing the content. The authors write documents that each are of a certain document type. The document type specifies what kind of information the document should provide. The document types are a kind of business rules and are composed by information architects, generally before any meaningful documents are written. All users, authors, editors and information architects have to get an account from a CMS administrator. Unlike the other users, CMS administrators have no part in the content of the CMS, they only assign permissions.
For documentation for specific roles, see the table. For a more general introduction on the use of the Hippo CMS, see below the table.

tr.td: Guide for Hippo CMS users to perform the role of author. (also called contributor, because in addition to writing, he may also supply images and other files.)
Guide for Hippo CMS users to perform the role of editor (reviewer, decides when ready for publication).
Guide for Hippo CMS users to perform the role of Information Architect (creator of document templates/types, i.e. the informational structure, conform the business rules of the organisation).
Guide for Hippo CMS users to perform the role of CMS administrator (assigns rights to authors, editors and information architects according to management decisions).

subsection.name: General introduction for users of the Hippo CMS
subsection.p: The use of document types guarantees that different documents are similar and this allows fast development of any application that makes use of the documents. For example, a web developer need only to know about a few document types to make a website for hundreds of thousands of documents. He need not know about the documents themselves. Users of the Hippo CMS need not know about making websites, just about what kind of information should be provided.
